HpeJYcTz.title: Advantages of oriented clinical practice of TCM undergraduates
HpeJYcTz.abstract: Objective To train qualified clinical-oriented talents.Methods The content of clinical practice was determined for clinical-oriented practice and training professional TCM talents based on a full investigation and advanced disciplines of Chinese internal medicine.Results The students have learnt the diagnosis and treatment of common and frequently-occurring diseases,known well the emergency measures of severe cases,comprehended national academic development and dealt independently with common and frequently-occurring diseases.The oriented training method was reviewed favourably by teachers and students.The employment rate of graduated students was improved obviously.Conclusion The clinical practice plan is regulated for a part of TCM undergraduates to clinical-oriented practice and meet the needs of all-level hospitals in Guangxi area.

DpKS2oxi.title: Analysis of TCM Syndrome Characteristics and Glucocorticoid Efficacy of IgA Nephropathy
DpKS2oxi.abstract: Objective:To investigate the characteristics of TCM syndromes and glucocorticoid treatment of IgA nephropathy changes,and to analyze the relationship between TCM syndrome type and therapeutic effect of glucocorticoid.Method:140 cases with IgA nephropathy diagnosed by renal biopsy,were made TCM types according to the uniform standard.According to the 24 h urinary protein quantitative level,they were divided into the experimental group 1(n=68;24 h urinary protein quantitative >3.5 g),experimental group 2(n=72;24 h urine protein fixed ≤ 3.5 g,≥ 1.0 g).Experiment 1 group received oral prednisone1 mg/(kg.d),experimental group 2 received oral prednisone 0.5 mg/(kg ? d);conventional hormone decrement,observation time was 6 months for both.Before and after the treatment,the main symptoms,tongue,pulse condition change and detection of 24 h levels of urinary protein,renal function were observed.Results:For IgA nephropathy,proteinuria was the main manifestation.In the use of glucocorticoid therapy,syndrome of deficiency of spleen and kidney were common in both two groups,followed by spleen obstructed by damp,and kidney deficiency and blood stasis syndrome was relatively less.Spleen obstructed by damp syndrome and spleen and kidney deficiency syndrome were improved by glucocorticoid therapy,and compared with those before treatment,syndrome remission rate of the former was more than 60%,and the latter was more than 50%,consistent with the decrease in proteinuria.only 1/3 of kidney deficiency and blood stasis syndrome can be improved by glucocorticoid therapy and proteinuria was in poor control.Decreased kidney function,visual fatigue,pale tongue,white fur,tongue edge teeth marks,spleen deficiency symptoms or dull tongue,pulse can be seen in those failing to be relieved.Conclusion:For IgA nephropathy with proteinuria as the main performance,spleen obstructed by damp and deficiency of both spleen and kidney can get obvious effect by glucocorticoid therapy,while kidney deficiency and blood stasis can not.Large doses glucocorticoid induced Yang hyperactivity due to Yin deficiency is rare.
DpKS2oxi.venue: Journal of Liaoning University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

pnDTql8O.title: Clinical Control Observation on Treament of Primary Nephrotic Syndrome with Adrenocortical Hormone and the Shuzhi Injection
pnDTql8O.abstract: Objective:To observe the clinical therapeutic effect on primary nephrotic syndrome with adrenocortical hormone(ACH) and the shuzhi injection.Methods:116 cases were randomly divided into two group the treatment group of 62 treated with ACH and the shuzhi injection and the control group of 54 cases only with ACH.Observations were made on the changes of urinary protein,renal function,plasma albumin,blood fat and blood rheology before and after the treatment and on the differences of recurrence rate and the incidence rate of adverse reaction between the two groups.Results:The total effective rate in the treatment group reached 88.7%,while the control group 70.4%(P<0.05).There were obviously changes between the two groups on urinary protein,renal function,plasma albumin,blood fat and blood rheology(P<0.05 or P<0.01).The recurrence rate(8%)and the incidence rate of adverse reaction(17.74%)in the treatment group were lower than those with(20.3%) and(42.5%) respectively(P<0.05).Conclusions:The better therapeutic effect can be achieved for primary nephrotie syndrome through the application of both ACH and the shuzhi injection than the single use of ACH.

4jX8IZTb.title: Acute aristolochic acid nephropathy due to kaempfer dutchmanspipe root poisoning
4jX8IZTb.abstract: A 73-year-old woman took about 20 g of kaemfer dutchmanpipe root powder for treating stomach discomfort.Ten minutes later,she developed vomiting.She did not resolve Despite symptomatic therapy.Three days later,she developed oliguria.A routine urine test revealed the following values:pH 9.0,Glu(+),PRO(┼┼),and KET(+).She had a BUN level of 17.8 mmol/L,a SCr level of 708 μmol/L,and a UA level of 294.5 μmol/L.A B-ultrasonography showed diffused parenchymatous lesions in the kidneys.She was diagnosed with acute aristolochic acid nephropathy and acute renal failure due to kaempfer dutchmanspipe root poisoning.After treatment with Jinshuibao capsules,dopamine,furosemide,sodium bicarbonate,hydrocortisone,and hemodialysis,the patient's urine volume gradually increased.Her renal function improved and the symptoms disappeared.At follow-up 3 months later,her renal function remained stable.

rullTjCA.title: Research on Connection Between Tongue Presentations of Dampness-heat Blockage of Rheumatoid Arthritis and Index of Disease Activity
rullTjCA.abstract: Objective:It is to analyze the correlation between tongue presentations of dampness-heat blockage of rheumatoid arthritis and index of activity by correlation analysis.Methods:Fifty patients of dampness-heat blockage of rheumatoid arthritis were analyzed.Tongue presentations were taken by digital camera,and the RGB valve of tongue color and coated tongue color were analyzed by computer.Constituent ratio of RGB of each patient was calculated,the thickness and stickiness of coated tongue were quantified,and the erythrocyte sedimentation rates,C-reactive protein,rheumatoid factor were detected synchronously.The correlation between color of tongue and coated tongue,thickness and stickiness of coated tongue and ESR,CRP,RF were studied.Results:For dampness-heat blockage of rheumatoid arthritis,it had positive correlation between constituent ratio R for tongue and ESR,CRP,RF(P<0.01),and it was converse for constituent ratio G and B(P<0.01).It had positive correlation between constituent ratio R for coated tongue and ESR,CRP,RF(P<0.05),and it had negative correlation between constituent ratio B and ESR,RF(P<0.05).It had no correlation between the thickness and stickiness of coated tongue and ESR,CRP,RF.Conclusion:The red tongue and yellow coated tongue are correlative to disease activity for dampness-heat blockage of rheumatoid arthritis.The more red tongue,more yellow coated tongue,and more vivid color is shown,the greater activity for the disease is sure.

QLQeHtgW.title: Studies on amino acid replacement and inhibitory activity of a beta-lactamase inhibitory peptide.
QLQeHtgW.abstract: An SHV beta-lactamase gene was amplified from a beta-lactam resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae K-71 genomic DNA. After expression and purification, we demonstrated that peptide P1 could inhibit the hydrolysis activity of both TEM-1 and SHV beta-lactamase in vitro. Three mutations were introduced into P1 in which the first residue S was replaced by F, the 18th residue V was mutated to Y, and the 15th residue Y was substituted with A, C, G, and R to obtain the mutants of P1-A, P1-C, P1-G, and P1-R, respectively. The mutant peptides were purified and their inhibitory constants against TEM-1 and SHV beta-lactamase were determined. All these beta-lactamase inhibitory peptides could inhibit the activity of both beta-lactamases, while the mutant peptides showed stronger inhibitory activities against TEM-1 beta-lactamase than against SHV beta-lactamase. Inhibition data suggested that P1-A improved the beta-lactamase inhibitory activity by over 3-fold compare to P1. When P1-A was incubated with K. pneumoniae K-71 in Luria-Bertani medium containing ampicillin, it showed a much stronger growth of inhibition ratio over P1. This study gives us a good candidate for development of novel beta-lactamase inhibitors.

ku3tx3Vq.title: Proteome Preparation for Acremonium chrysogenum
ku3tx3Vq.abstract: Two methods——liquid nitrogen grinding-lysing enzymes digestion and urea-thiourea lysis coupled with trichloroacetic acid(TCA)-acetone extraction,were used respectively to prepare the total protein from a filamentous fungus Acremonium chrysogenum 84-3-87.The proteome obtained by different methods were then determined by SDS-PAGE and two-dimensional electrophoresis.The results showed that the latter method could obtain higher concentration and more protein bands/dots,especially with less tail phenomenon and fewer horizontal streaks in 2-DE image.The established preparation method could be applied for the further comparative proteomics research.

S3vaYHj1.title: High-level Expression,Purification and Activity of the Plectasin
S3vaYHj1.abstract: The gene coding plectasin mature peptide isolated from a saprophytic fungus was optimized according to the E.coli codon preference,and inserted into a pET-32a(+)-TEV carrier.Then a recombinant plasmid pYG330 for high-level expression of recombinant plectasin fusion protein was constructed.Fusion protein were expressed in the soluble fraction.The fusion protein contained both His-tag label for affinity chromatography and specific enzymes recognition sites of TEV enzyme for fusion protein efficient cutting.High purity plectasin was achieved through three key purification processes,affinity chromatography after desalting,enrichment by freeze-dry,and another step of HPLC.Plectasin obtained in this study showed marked antibacterial activity against clinical drug-resistance bacteria of Staphylococcus aureus M-2 and Bacillus subtilis.

vnngnH9X.title: Cloning,Expression and Purification of SHV β-Lactamase Gene from Klebsiella pneumoniae
vnngnH9X.abstract: A previously identified recombinant polypeptide SIPIS-04-01 showed inhibitory activity against TEM-1 β-lactamase. In order to investigate its activity against SHV β-lactamase, a coding sequence was successfully obtained from a clinical isolate Klebsiella pneumoniae 10032. An E. coli host containing a recombinant plasmid on which gene shv was substituted for original bla on plasmid pUC18 showed resistance to ampicillin. shv was then subcloned into an expression vector pLY-5 and was expressed as the form of inclusion body. A homogenized SHV β-lactamase was finally obtained by isolation and purification and ampicillin could be degraded by this enzyme. However, this degradation could be in vitro inhibited by SIPIS-04-01 to some extent.

sHFRh2q6.title: Directed Evolution of Cephalosporin C Acylase Activity by Error-prone PCR
sHFRh2q6.abstract: In previous study,we obtained a cephalosporin C(CPC) acylase which could transform CPC to 7-aminocephalosporanic acid(7-ACA).Error-prone PCR was used to evolve this enzyme by adding different concentration of Mg2+ and Mn2+.The PCR product was cloned and transformed into E.coli..More than 400 mutants were screened and 35 mutants showed increased activity.These improved mutants were purified by metal chelate affinity chromatography.After the secondary screening,one mutant showed significant elevated activity compared to the control and CPC conversion rate was enhanced approximately by 35%.The sequencing result showed that there were two point mutations in the mutate protein.The 122-alanine was substituted by valine.Further transformation research was conducted under the optimal conditions and the CPC conversion rate could reach 95%.

n1DX1BdP.title: Cloning and Disruption of dnmV from Daunorubicin-producing Strain Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482
n1DX1BdP.abstract: dnmV was PCR amplified along with its upstream dnmU gene from genomic DNA of Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482, which was one of the daunorubicin-producers. Homologous recombination was used for dnmV gene disruption in SIPI-1482, and one genetically stable disruptant was obtained. The homologous DNA fragment which was sufficient in length for recombination to occur in this strain was identified.

qdv0RGzm.title: Expression and Characterization of Thrombin Inhibitor TTI
qdv0RGzm.abstract: TTI gene coding for Tsetse thrombin inhibitor was modified with E.coli bias codon and expressed in Escherichia coli with high efficiency.Recombinant protein was purified to more than 98% purity.Assay for enzyme activity determination was set up.The result showed that the fusion protein exhibited inhibiting activity for thrombin.Inhibitory rate of purified TTI was 73% when concentration of thrombin and substrate was 10U/ml and 250μmol/L respectively.Inhibition pattern was determined as competitive with Ki at 35μmol/L.

EOgUk3ai.title: Study on cloning and expression of daunorubicin C-14 hydroxylase gene under the control of SnpR-activated snpA promoter
EOgUk3ai.abstract: Doxorubicin is produced through chemical semisynthesis initiated from daunorubicin. In this paper, the process of microbial conversion was studied for the production of doxorubicin. A DNA fragment containing C-14 hydroxylase encoding gene doxA, approximate 1.3kb including a ribosome binding site GGAGG was amplified from daunorubicin-producing strain Streptomyces sp. C5. At the same time, the SnpR-activated snpA promoter sequence was also amplified from Streptomyces sp. C5. The recombinant plasmid, pYG908, was constructed for the expression of doxA under the control of snpA promoter, while snpA was regulated by SnpR protein. SDS-PAGE indicated that the engineered strain could apparently express a 46. 6ku band according to the deduced molecular weight of daunorubicin C-14 hydroxylase. DoxA activity was confirmed by CO-binding differential absorbance at 450nm. pYG908 was introduced into Streptomyces lividans TK24 and the resultant engineering strains could convert daunorobicin into a product which has a similar retention time with doxorubicin by HPLC.

nylP9sXE.title: Research progress on tumor-targeting immunoconjugate
nylP9sXE.abstract: Targeting cancer therapeutic agents have become the hot spot for cancer research recently.The appropriate targeting antibody drugs can be prepared for specific targets(antigens).Monoclonal antibodies conjugated to protein toxins,radioisotopes,and chemotherapy drugs can both improve efficacy and reduce systemic toxicity.This review summarizes the characteristics,mechanism,and the development trend of marketed drugs for the three types of tumor-targeting immunoconjugate.

hsyF07KO.title: Improvement of 7-ACA Production by Genome Shuffling
hsyF07KO.abstract: pYG232,an expression plasmid containing CPC acylase gene ecs,was transformed into the CPC-producing strain Acremonium chrysogenum to construct a recombinant strain that could produce 7-ACA via fermentation.This plasmid contains phleomycin resistance gene(phleo).The strain was used as one of the parental strains in genome shuffling.pYG236,which also contained ecs gene and hygromycin resistance gene(hgh),was constructed and used as another parental strain in genome shuffling.The presence of both antibiotic resistance was used as the screening marker.By genome shuffling,a recombinant strain with 6.5 fold higher yield of 7-ACA over the parental strain was obtained.

JVLzfu8A.title: Research on Disruption of a Ketoreductase Gene dnrU in Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482
JVLzfu8A.abstract: Objective:To investigate the effect of disruption of a ketoreductase gene dnrU on metabolites of daunorubicin producer Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482.Methods:The metabolites of SIPI-1482 includes daunorubicin,(13s)-13-dihydrodaunorubicin,ε-rhodomycinone,etc,among which(13s)-13-dihydrodaunorubicin was transformed from daunorubicin by a ketoreductase encoded by dnrU gene.A recombinant plasmid was constructed based on E.coli vector pUC18,and the aparamycin resistant gene was inserted into dnrU gene in SIPI-1482 chromosome to screen the dnrU block mutant.Results & Conclusion:dnrU was successfully disrupted via homologous recombination which was confirmed by PCR.(13s)-13-dihydrodaunorubicin was absent from the mutant metabolites and other fermentation products were also changed after dnrU was disrupted.

wjhnd3mP.title: Cloning of dnrV Gene from Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482 and Its Application
wjhnd3mP.abstract: A 840bp DNA fragment containing dnrV gene in full length of 828bp was amplified from daunorubicin-producing strain Streptomyces coeruleorubidus SIPI-1482 by PCR,and then was subcloned into E.coli expression vectors pET-32a(+) and pET-28a(+).After IPTG induction,an obvious polypeptide band was observed by SDS-PAGE electrophoresis and was further confirmed by Western blotting.Furthermore,both dnrV and doxA genes were cloned into two Streptomyces expression vector pYG505 or pYG907,in which both genes were regulated by either promoter PermE or PsnpA.The results showed that introduction of both dnrV and doxA into SIPI-1482 could significantly increase the yield of daunorubicin fermentation.

mz99c6VI.title: Tandem Repeat Expression and Inhibitory Activity of a β-lactamase Inhibitory Peptide
mz99c6VI.abstract: β-lactamase inhibitor research is popular for its potential on β-lactam antibiotics resistant strain.A β-lactamase binding peptide SIPIS04-01 was obtained by the yeast two-hybid system.In vitro assay showed that it can inhibit the β-lactamase activity.In order to improve the expression level of the recombinant peptide,a two-copy expression plasmid pYG563 was constructed by random orientation tandem repeat method after codon modification,the two-copy plasmid was successfully expressed and the product was increased by 48.4% than that of one-copy plasmid.Purified peptide showed inhibitory activity against TEM-1 β-lactamase in vitro and the inhhibitory constant Ki was measured.

FHz3z1Gm.title: Progress in the Research of Biosynthesis of Tetracyclines
FHz3z1Gm.abstract: Tetracyclines are broad spectrum antibiotics which can inhibit protein synthesis and are widely used to treat various bacterial infections.The biosynthesis cluster of tetracyclines belongs to type Ⅱ polyketide synthase(PKS Ⅱ) which generates the poly-β-ketone backbone through successive decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA extender units followed by modifications by cyclases,oxygenases,transferases and additional tailoring enzymes.Genetic and biochemical studies have illustrated most of the steps involved in the biosynthesis of tetracyclines,which may be helpful to better understanding and regulation of the biosynthesis of this type of polyketides.

uIsWNw7l.title: Scanning Electron Microscopic Observation of Lingual Papillae and Connective Tissue Core in Rats Tongue Cancer
uIsWNw7l.abstract: Objective To observe the transform of tongue carcinoma lingual papilla and the connective tissue cores(CTC) structure change by scanning electron microscope(SEM)in SD rat.Methods Specimens were immersed in 3.5N hydrochloric acid to remove the epithelial cell layer to expose lingual papilla′s CTC.Results The filiform papillae and CTC showed cauliflower-like change with polarity dissapearance and arrangement disorderly.Fungiform papillae's CTC shrank and degenerated obviously,and taste buds became shallow and even disappeared,the papilla on the eminence and root of the tongue arranged disorderly and lost their organized directions inclining to the throat.Conclusion The morphological change of lingual papilla and CTC three-dimensional architecture was obvious characteristics in the tongue cancer.

84XqFEP0.title: Morphological study of lingual papillae in SD's rat's by scanning electron microscope microscope (SEM)
84XqFEP0.abstract: Objective To study the morphous of rat's lingual papillae by SEM. Methods To get the tongue tissue of health rat's,to clean them sufficienfly and to make the of SEM.. Results In SEM, watched four types of lingual papillae on the back rat's surface of mucous membrane:filiform papillae,fungiform papillae, vallate papillae and foliate papillae.Filiform papillae in the different part of tongue among them,and its morphous was also different. Conclusions Filiform papillae is the disrinctive lingual papillae of rat's.

hN6kCGmN.title: Morphological Observation of Inhibition Effect on B16 Melanoma of CIK Cells Induced by DCs loaded with Tumor Antigen
hN6kCGmN.abstract: Objective:To investigate the inhibitory effect of cytokine-induced ldller (CIK) cells on B16 melanoma cells induced by dendritic cells (DCs) loaded with tumor antigen.Methods:DCs and CIK cells were separated and cultured respective- ly,then DCs were loaded with tumor antigen;subsequently half of CIK cells were cultured and induced by DCs loaded with tumor antigen,while others continued to be co-culture with DCs.According to the change of tumor volume and the tumor inhibition rates,inhibitory effect of CIK cells on B16 melanoma cells was estimated.Distribution and morphological characteristics of immune cells in tumor tissue were observed by optical microscopy,electron microscopy and immunohistochemistry.Results:Tumor inhibi- tion rate of DC-CIK cells loaded with tumor antigen (86.57%) was higher than that of either CIK cells (33.34%,P<0.05) or DC- CIK cells (61.08%,P<0.05).DC-CIK cells with tumor antigen were mainly gathered in the subcutaneous tissue and the tumor tis- sue,especially around the cancer nest.The DC-CIK cells were bigger than the normal lymphocytes and notch always appears on the cellular nucleus observed under TEM.Plenty of active-functioned organelles such as dilated endoplasmic reticulum were ob- served in the cytoplasm of the DC-CIK.Protrusions on the surface of the DC-GIK cells contacted dosdy with the tumor cells. Apoptosis and necrosis of the cells could be widely observed in tumor tissues.Conclusion:Inhibitory effect of DC-CIK loaded with tumor antigen on B16 melanoma is stronger than that of CIK or DC-CIK.

ouHXdp1W.title: Comparative study on the tongue carcinoma model induced by local application both of 7,12-dimethylbenz [a] anthracene (DMBA) and injury
ouHXdp1W.abstract: Objective To establish a tongue carcinoma model in Sprague-Dawley rat and Golden hamster which is similar to the human tongue carcinoma, induced by DMBA and injury for further oral carcinogenesis research. To contrast the pathological expression in the two kinds of models of tongue carcinoma. Methods The left border tongue of the Sprague-Dawley rat and Gold hamster was applied with 1% DMBA acetone solution and chronic mechanical injury locally three times a week for 24 weeks. The pathological appearance was studied by light microscope and transmission electron microscope. Results Different pathological changes including anabrosis, leukoplakia, and intumescence which appeared on the left dorsum border of the tongue were observed in 3rd day after treatment in Sprague-Dawley rat and Golden hamster. The epithelial layer proliferation and basal cell heteromorphism was examined by light microscope and TEM after 8 weeks. We found that the basal cells together with basal membrane invade into lamina propria in Sprague-Dawley rat. At the 16th week, poor differentiation cancer cells and none of horny pearl were detected. The carcinogenesis rate in Sprague-Dawley rat was 76.6% (23 / 30). Leukoplakia and papillary epithelioma, followed by mucosal erosion, was found in Golden hamster after 8 weeks, and exophytic tumor was visible obviously. Hyperplasia of epithelium cells, high differentiation cancer cells and horny pearl were identified. The carcinogenesis rate in Golden hamster was 93.3% (28 / 30). Conclusion Local application both of 1% DMBA acetone solution and chronic mechanical injury on the tongue mucous membrane could induce tongue carcinoma successfully both in Sprague-Dawley rat and Golden hamster. It demonstrated that this is a good technique to establish a well stable , easily duplicated and high ratio of carcinogenesis tongue carcinoma model for the tongue carcinoma research. Furthermore , the carcinogenesis ratio in Golden hamster is higher than that of Sprague-Dawley rat. In general, the tongue carcinoma in Golden hamster was mainly high differentiation carcinoma and that of Sprague-Dawley rat was mainly poor differentiation carcinoma.

TH7YFoFP.title: Review and thought of Guangxi hybrid rice regional trial conducted in 2009
TH7YFoFP.abstract: Five hundreds and sixty hybrid combinations participated in Guangxi hybrid rice regional trail in 2009.Yield /unit area of hybrid rice increased obviously,the highest increasing rate of yield in early and middle maturing groups planted in early crop,and photosensitive group planted in late crop were 6.86%,8.96% and 7.84%,respectively.In screening test,the highest increasing rate of yield of late maturing group planted in early crop,and middle maturing planted in late crop and group planted in middle crop were 10.01%,13.20% and 10.32%,respectively.On the whole,the photosensitive hybrid rice was better than thermo-sensitive one in grain quality.Chalky rice rate and chalk degree of the photosensitive hybrid rice whose chalky grain rate was the first class according to rice quality standards of China was 50.0% and 20.8%,respectively,and both of them were higher than thermo-sensitive hybrid rice.No combination was found moderate or high susceptible to rice blast and bacterial blight.Overall,method of hybridization between wide and cultivated species was put forward to solve the problem of breeding selection.

4EMUU59W.title: Prospects and advancement in super hybrid rice breeding in China
4EMUU59W.abstract: The present study is an attempt to review the history of super hybrid rice breeding in China and abroad and an introduction to advancement in super hybrid rice breeding in China.At present,a great breakthrough in utilizing subspecies heterosis of indica and japonica rice and plant type breeding has been obtained in super hybrid rice breeding in China,and super hybrid rice has been extended for large scale cultivation.But,there are many problems existing in super hybrid rice cultivation,such as poorer adaptability,lower seed setting rate,bad grain quality,worse resistance to biotic and abiotic stresses,fewer double-cropping super rice varieties(combinations),imperfect breeding theory and technology.Therefore,some suggestions and research prospects have been put forward for overcoming these problems.

pfHcy9ok.title: Current Status Analysis of Hybrid Rice Development in China
pfHcy9ok.abstract: Based on the data included in annual reports of ″National Statistical Tables of Growing Status on Major Agricultural Crop Varieties in China ″provided by China National Agricultural Service Center under Ministry of Agriculture,the authors analyzed the status and trends of hybrid rice development in the past 15 years(1990—2004),which includes the changes of the number of hybrids derived from different major MS lines and their growing areas,and discussed the trend and direction for sustainable development of hybrid rice in China in the future.

NLziIGDo.title: Feasibility analysis on breeding rice new varieties with good quality and high yield
NLziIGDo.abstract: In recent years,a certain achievements on the yield and quality breeding of rice have been achieved in China,and the yield and quality of hybrid rice combination and inbred varieties are also increased further in Guangxi,but the problem that the yield and quality of good quality rice can not be increased simultaneously still exists.Aiming at this situation,in the future,the breeding goals of good quality rice with high yield are to strengthen the breeding of large panicle and mid-long grain,reduce the chalky grain rate and chalkiness,increase the head rice rate,and adjust the amylase content and gel consistency,etc.On the base of keeping high and stable yield and total yield,the coordinated breeding of high-grade,mid-grade and popularization good quality rice should be paid attention to.Through the selection and breeding of rice parents with high yield and good quality,etc.it would be able to increase the yield and quality of good quality rice.

2iLrGW3G.title: Current Status and Development Strategies of Thermo-sensitive Early Maturing Rice Hybrids Breeding in Guangxi,China
2iLrGW3G.abstract: This paper discussed the importance,application and the current status of thermo-sensitive early maturing rice hybrids for Guangxi's rice production.It had a great development of breeding thermo-sensitive early maturing hybrids in Guangxi in recent years.But there are some problems,including not enough hybrids released and weak resistance of this kind hybrids,imbalance of yield and grain quality.Based on the analysis,the some considerations of breeding thermo-sensitive early maturing rice hybrids in Guangxi,China have been advised in the paper.
2iLrGW3G.venue: Southwest China Journal of Agricultural Sciences

7Mm0V59a.title: Genetics of resistance to bacterial blight and rice blast for two rice germplasm parents
7Mm0V59a.abstract: In the experiment,two rice disease-resistant parents 25-289,IR71676-34-1-1,and two susceptible parents Gui 649 and Ze 253 were crossed and combined,bacterial liquid of bacterial blight and rice blast were inoculated to parents and their F1,F2 to discuss the genetic expression in progeny of resistance gene to bacterial blight and rice blast for two rice germplasm.The result showed that the rice bacterial blight resistance gene to the preponderant physiological race in Guangxi of 25-289 was controlled by one dominant major gene,while that of IR71676-34-1-1was controlled by one recessive gene.The rice blast resistance genes of two germplasm parents were encoded by one dominant major gene.Moreover,the bacterial blight and rice blast gene of two rice resistant parents were independent in inheritance.The results could provide theoretical basis on studying and breeding new multi-resistance rice variety.

NfbcPq0Q.title: Effects of microwave radiation on growth of rice
NfbcPq0Q.abstract: The seeds of three rice pure lines were treated with six different microwave radiation durations to study the effects of microwave radiation on the growth of first generation.The results showed that the germination rate of seeds was decreased with the increase of microwave radiation time,while the tillering was increased.The duration from seeding to heading of three rice pure line as treated with different microwave radiations decreased 2-7 days as compared to the control.Most of microwave radiation treatments were not beneficial to regulate the yield components of two rice pure lines R225 and Minghui 63,resulting in decrease in the yield per plant.As treated with 70 seconds one time or 50 seconds every time for three replications,the total grains per panicle,seed setting rate and 1000-grain weight of pure line Te B could be balanced,and the yield per plant was increased.Therefore,different microwave radiation treatments had different bio-effects on the growth of different rice pure lines,and the results could provide basis to the radiation mutation breeding of rice.

7Dtp0WgP.title: Breeding and application of medium maturity combination Teyou 136
7Dtp0WgP.abstract: Teyou 136 is a new strong thermosensitive type hybrid combination with medium maturity,which was bred through a crossbreeding between Longtefu A as female parent and R136 as male parent.It presented good plant type,good harmony of panicle and grain configuration,suitable maturation period,good quality and strong resistance,etc.Teyou 136 is adapted to plant in middle and south rice zones of Guangxi as early and late rice,and in north zones of Guangxi as late rice.It was certified by Guangxi Committee for Crop Variety Registration in Feb.2006.

aWZUH27r.title: Breeding and Utilization of New Restorer Line 08 with Good Grain Quality in Rice
aWZUH27r.abstract: 08 is a thermo-sensitive medium maturity and fine-quality rice restorer line,which is derived from the cross of the restorer line Gui 227 or Qiguizhan as male and Youzhan 8 as female and developed by the Guangxi Rice Research Institute.It is characteristic of good plant type,strong tillering ability,heavy pollen load,good disease resistances,high combining ability,strong restoring ability,good grain quality and medium maturity.Among its hybrids,Qiyou 08 showed high-yielding ability,good grain quality and medium maturity and was certified and registered by the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Crop Variety Appraisal Committee in 2006.

Rh4yy9dG.title: A review on yield, grain quality and resistance of hybrid rice in Guangxi
Rh4yy9dG.abstract: The general aspects such as yield,quality and the resistance of hybrid rice in Guangxi have been studied using these hybrid rice combinations which have been certified and registered by Guangxi Committee for Crop Variety Registration from 2000 to 2005.It was pointed out that the yield,resistance and quality of hybrid rice could not fully meet with the real needs.It was put forward that elite germplasm of wild rice was essential for making breakthrough in hybrid rice breeding,and hybrid rice selective breeding should be strengthened.In order to enrich the diversity of hybrid rice type and further improve the yield,quality and resistance,super hybrid rice combinations should be selectively bred according to the ecological conditions in Guangxi by fully exploring the wild rice germplasm resources in Guangxi.

xmXl5nRn.title: Screen Test for Resources with Resistant to Rice Bacterial Blight and Blast Disease
xmXl5nRn.abstract: Sixty rice varieties and germplasm resources introduced from IRRI and fifty from China were researched and evaluated to rice bacterial blight,blast disease and main agronomic traits in 2006～2007 in Guangxi.The result showed that there were twenty-three varieties with high to moderately resistant to bacterial than the others.Accounting for 20.91% of the total evaluated varieties;and eighteen varieties with resistant to blast,accounting for 16.36% of the total evaluated varieties.At the last,seven varieties were selected with resistant to bacterial blight and blast disease,and their main agronomic traits had a great discrepant.It was indicated that there were diversified hereditary for these resources.So,it is very high value in using them to breeding new varieties(combinations) with high yield and disease resistant.

boEgmqHa.title: Progresses,Problems and Countermeasures of Rice Breeding in Guangxi
boEgmqHa.abstract: Main progresses of rice breeding in Guangxi were systematically discussed including the realization of the large-scale production application of the improved rice species,the breakthrough of super rice breeding and the breeding theory and practice of higher,thicker and tougher rice varieties.The existing problems were analyzed and the development countermeasures in future were discussed.

uREnJC2C.title: How to improve the efficiency of hybrid breeding and combination utilization in rice
uREnJC2C.abstract: Hybrid rice has made great contribution to rice production and food security in China.The breeders' team for hybrid rice is very big due to quick expansion,and the total number of new rice hybrid varieties developed and released has been increasing year by year rapidly.The number of rice hybrid varieties which covering area more than 6666.7 hm2 increased from 39 in 1989 to 379 in 2005,that is almost eight times increased.However,the percentage of hybrid rice in total rice area is not increased,and the average growing area of each hybrid combination declined significantly.New rice hybrids with great breakthrough in yield,resistances and quality are very few,and the average longevity of the new rice hybrids has been shortened considerably,which means the efficiency of rice hybrid breeding and the combination utilization has been decreased.Therefore,how to increase the efficiency of hybrid rice breeding as well the combination utilization in the future becomes very important,and this problem was discussed in the paper.

1ChkgG37.title: Evaluation and utilization of international network of genetic evaluation for rice(INGER) nurseries in Guangxi province of China
1ChkgG37.abstract: International Network of Genetic Evaluation for Rice(INGER) is a world wide cooperative program of rice germplasm exchange,evaluation and utilization organized by International Rice Research Institute(IRRI).It is also one of the best ways to introduce foreign rice germplasms and breeding materials~[1].This program has been started in 1979 in Guangxi.Up to date,13 kinds of INGER nurseries including total 17,000 seed materials have been conducted by the Rice Research Institute and Plant Protection Institute of Guangxi Academy of Agricultural Sciences(GXAAS) since then.Great number of elite rice germplasms and breeding materials with high yield potential,good grain quality,multiresistance to disease and insect pests,adoptable to the local eco-conditions,and restoring and maintaining genes have been screened and evaluated out through the INGER nurseries in Guangxi.These elite germplasm materials not only enriched the collection contents of the rice gene-bank but also expanded the genetic background of variety improvement in Guangxi.As counted from 1999,about 600 entrances from INGER nurseries have been evaluated as promising breeding materials with various elite traits,and more than 8,000 seed samples have been provided to about 20 research institutions in and out side Gunagxi province for breeding or other studies.INGER program has played an important role in raising rice production level,especially for rice grain quality improvement,increasing the resistances to disease and insect pests,and breeding for rice hybrids as well as inbred.Based on incomplete statistics,by use of germplasms from INGER nurseries,six inbred varieties and 17 rice hybrids have been developed and released in commercial production for years and brought great economic and social profits in Guangxi province.Though there are some problems and difficulties,including financial and management issues to improve and perfect the implementation of INGER program not only in Guangxi but also in some other provinces of China,we are still strongly hoping the continuation of INGER program with increasing of some specially needed breeding materials;collectively delivering and receiving the seed materials from IRRI instead of one each,applying the state research project to get some funds from the government by national coordinator to organize the engaged institutes,and organizing field trips.

Vm6jMAHf.title: Reaction to short photoperiod treatment of common rice hybrids and their restorer lines in Guangxi
Vm6jMAHf.abstract: Based on the previous results obtained in 2004,total sixteen entries including rice hybrid combinations and their restorer lines and some inbred lines,were tested in 2005 for the reaction to short day length treatments to know the changes of some main agronomic traits.The results showed that the short day length treatments could significantly shorten the growth duration of photo-sensitive type hybrids and inbred lines,and meanwhile reduce the leaf number of the main stem and the grain number per panicle of them.For the thermo-sensitive entries,the single plant yield of CK was the lowest compared to other different treatments.But for the photo-sensitive materials,the yield of CK was higher or the highest compared to other treatments.There were no regularly effects on plant height,panicle length,filled grain number,seed setting rate,1000-grain weight and plot yield,either with treatments or CK for both thermo-sensitive and photo-sensitive ones in this study.

Uce2ZYzL.title: Breeding and Application of New Fine Quality and Early Maturing Hybrid Rice Combination Zaoyou 11
Uce2ZYzL.abstract: Zaoyou 11 is a thermo-sensitive early maturing hybrid rice combination derived from the newly developed WA type CMS line Zao A and the restorer line Ke 11.It showed a high yielding ability,but it was susceptible to blast and bacterial leaf blight in the regional trials of Guangxi during 2003—2005.Its grain quality was very good.The analysis results showed that it met the state quality standards for the first grade fine quality cooking rice of indica variety.Zaoyou 11 was certified and registered by the Guangxi Crop Variety Registration Committee in February,2006.

OlawXGvG.title: Effects of short day length treatment on major traits of photosensitive hybrid rice combination
OlawXGvG.abstract: Thermosensitive hybrids used as check,seven photosensitive rice hybrids were treated with artificial short day length(ASDL) and natural short day length(NSDL) in this study.The results showed that growth duration of the photosensitive rice hybrids could be shortened about 30 days and 60 days under ASDL and NSDL treatment in Nanning,respectively.The photosensitive rice hybrid treated with ASDL,plant height and total grains per panicle were decreased while effective panicle per plant was increased.Treated with NSDL,the total leave number of main culm was declined and seed setting rate was increased.

Rga6qJBY.title: Seed dormancy characteristics of restorer lines of indica hybrid rice
Rga6qJBY.abstract: The present experiment has been conducted to identify the seed dormancy characteristics in the restorer lines of indica hybrid rice.Seed germination tests were carried out after harvest,using three hybrid rice(planted in early and late cropping during 2007-2009) pure restorer lines as experimental materials.The results showed differed seed dormancy amongst different rice materials harvested during the same season.The same pure lines harvested in different seasons in a year also had different dormancy period.And rice restorer seeds harvested at different seasons had different dormancy periods.The materials with strong dormancy had different dormancy period when planted as early and late crops,while it was not significant on the materials with weak dormancy.In general,the dormancy period of the same material which was harvested in late season was longer than that harvested in early season.And the seed dormancy of the same material harvested in the same season between different years had certain difference.

CJj9Doon.title: Review and Discussion of Guangxi Hybrid Rice Regional Trial Conducted in 2006 and 2007 Year
CJj9Doon.abstract: The process of Guangxi hybrid rice trail conducted in 2006 and 2007 had been reviewed and through the analyzed data,some suggestions for further improvement of Guangxi hybrid rice trail were pointed out by the authors. The two years data of the trail shown that abundance of hybrid combinations were tested and more progresses on quantity, yield and quality of hybrid rice were obtained, but there are still some problems such as resistance to insect and disease , and the integrated traits, which affecting the breakthrough of hybrid rice breeding. So the authors suggested that the genetic bases of new hybrids should be expanded, through strengthening genetic utilization between indica rice and japonica rice, utilization of elite wild rice germplasm and to put resistance breeding of hybrid rice into important position of daily work. And make further improvement on integrated traits and their coordination forward to breeding super high yielding rice hybrids in the future.

UKRhu2zH.title: VEGF-C Expression and Clinical Significance in Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
UKRhu2zH.abstract: Objective To observe the expression of VEGF-C(vascular endothelial growth factor C) in human esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.And to investigate the relation between the expression of VEGF-C in lymph node metastasis and lymph node metastasis.Methods The expression of VEGF-C protein was examined in 40 esophageal squamous cell carcinoma which sort as lymph node metastasis group and nonmetastatic group by immunohistochemistry.Contrast with the contol group.Results The expression of VEGF-C protein was mainly detected in cytoplasm of malignant cells.And the expression was significantly higher in lymph node metastatic group than that in nonmetastatic group(P<0.05).Conclusion The high expression of VEGF-C may closely related to the generation of lymphatic vessel and lymph node metastasis in Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.

fUTXTLqO.title: PLAG1 Expression and Its Relationship with ER and P53 in Pleomorphic Adenoma
fUTXTLqO.abstract: Objective To expiore the PLAG1expression and analyze the relation between the expression and ER and P53 in pleomorphic adenoma.Methods The expression of PLAG1,ER and P53 in pleomorphic adenoma was detected by using immunohistochemical method.Results In 45 cases of pleomorphic adenoma,the PLAG1,ER and P53 expression was positive,PLAG1 showing a strongly positive expression.The expression level of PLAG1 in recurrence group was lower than that in no recurrence group.The expression of PLAG1,ER and P53 was present in pleomorphic adenoma.Conclusion There was PLAG1,ER and P53 expression in pleomorphic adenoma,with a close correlation among the three.It is suggested that the expression of PLAG1 ER and P53 should be a valuable marker in predicting the biological behavior of pleomorphic adenoma.

0aC76WXm.title: Expression of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor D in Animal Models of Myosarcoma
0aC76WXm.abstract: Objective To establish rhabdomyosarcoma mouse models for researching the mechanism of lymphatic and hematogenous metastasis of rhabdomyosarcoma.To provide theoretical basis for clinical myosarcoma treatment.Methods Malignant ascites of S180 mouses were planted in muscular layer of gluteal region for establish myofibrosarcoma orthotopic tumor model in 30 sanitation NH mouses.The growth condition of tumor was observed closely.The mouses was killed after the model was set up one week later.The tumors was desected and the volume and weight of tumors were detected.The chest and abdomen were explored to observe condition of neoplasm metastasis,the relation of tumor vessels and the growth of lymphatic invasion and tumor metastatic were analyzed.The tissue of tumor was embeded and sliced for pathological analysis.Immunohistochemisty and Western blot were used to detect the expression of vascular endothelial growth factor D(VEGF-D).LMVD in myosarcoma was calculated by using lymphatic vessel endothelial hyaluronan receptor-1 as the specific marker of lymphatic endothelium.Results There were many lymphatic vessels in centre and marginal zone of rhabdomyosarcoma tissue observed.It showed that lymphatic hyperplasia and neogenesis was seen in rhabdomyosarcoma tissue.Conclusion The positive expression of VEGF-D in rhabdomyosarcoma was related with lymphatic neogenesis,VEGF-D might play an important role and promote lymphatic metastasis of rhabdomyosarcoma.

YUvjCpVW.title: The construction and practice of network teaching platform of systematic anatomy
YUvjCpVW.abstract: Objective To cultivate the students' autonomous learning ability,improve teaching effect,using the new mode of network teaching platform in the teaching of systematic anatomy.Methods Build and improve the network teaching platform of systematic anatomy.Select 117 students from the major of 2012 pharmaceutical preparation,2012 pharmaceutical engineering and 2012 Chinese materia medica to set up experimental group,using the teaching method of network teaching platform on the basis of the traditional teaching;select 123 students from the major of 2011 Pharmaceutical preparation,2011 Pharmaceutical Engineering and 2011 Chinese materia medica set up a controlled group using the traditional teaching mode.Use the way of questionnaire in the experimental group and compare examination results between the two groups to summary and analysis.Results The results of questionnaire of experimental group show that most students believe that the network teaching platform can increase their comprehensive ability from all sides,and are satisfied with it.Contrast the examination results of the two groups were shown that the excellent score of students in the experimental group was better than the control group(P < 0.05),with statistical significance.Conclusion Using network teaching platform in the teaching of systematic anatomy can make this difficult subject have a new breakthrough in teaching mode,it also can train students to learn how to use extracurricular learning time,it has a significant effect in improving scores and personal capability.

6Yj5y556.title: Expression of VEGF-C and LYVE-1 in animal models of myosarcoma
6Yj5y556.abstract: 【Objective】 To establish rhabdomyosarcoma model for researching the mechanism of lymphatic and hematogenous metastasis in order to provide theoretical basis for clinical myosarcoma treatment.【Method】 30 mice were inoculated with malignant ascites of S180 mice in muscular layer of gluteal region to establish myofibrosarcoma orthotopic tumor model.The mice were sacrificed in the different time after 1 week and the volume and weight of tumors were detected.The condition of neoplasm metastasis and the relation of tumor vessel and the growth of lymphatic and tumor metastatic were observed after opening the chest and abdomen.the tissue of tumor was used for embedding and slicing.Immunohistochemisty and western blot were used to detect the expression of VEGF-C.LMVD in myosarcoma was calculated by using LYVE-1 as the specific marker of lymphatic endothelium.【Results】 There were many lymphatic vessels in centre and marginal zone of rhabdomyosarcoma tissue.It showed that rhabdomyosarcoma tissue had lymphatic hyperplasia and neogenesis.【Conclusion】 The positive expression of VEGF-C in rhabdomyosarcoma is related with lymphatic neogenesis.VEGF-C might play an important role in lymphatic metastasis of rhabdomyosarcoma.

1WdpTNCy.title: Correlation of nm23 and P53 Expression in Breast Tissue with Invasion and Metastasis
1WdpTNCy.abstract: Objective To explore the relationship between the positive expression of tissue P53 and nm23 in breast cancer and the invasion and metastasis.Methods We selected 60 cases of breast cancer specimens in our department from Feb.2006 to Feb.2009 and used immunohistochemical staining to detect the positive expression of nm23 and P53.Results The positive expression rates of tissue nm23 and P53 in 60 cases of breast cancer were 85.0%(51/60)and 53.3%(32/60),respectively.The positive expression rate of tissue nm23 was lowered with increased histological grading(P<0.05).The nm23 positive expression rate in lymph node metastasis was lower than that without lymph node metastasis(P<0.05) and the P53 positive expression was correlated with histological grading(P<0.05).There was a significant difference between nm23 expression and P53 expression(χ2=4.22,P<0.05).Spearman rank correlation analysis showed a negative correlation in the expression of both in breast cancer tissue(r=-0.480,P<0.05).Conclusion The expression of tissue nm23 and P53 in breast cancer can be used as one of the indicators for the invasive and metastatic potential of breast cancer,which is of important clinical significance.

sWD5VRND.title: Influencing Mechanism of Ocean Acidification on Byssus Performance in the Pearl Oyster Pinctada fucata.
sWD5VRND.abstract: The byssus is an important adhesive structure by which bivalves robustly adhere to underwater substrates. It is susceptible to carbon dioxide-driven ocean acidification (OA). Previous investigations have documented significant adverse effects of OA on the performance of byssal threads, but the mechanisms remain largely unknown. In this study, multiple approaches were employed to reveal the underlying mechanisms for the effects of OA on byssus production and mechanical properties in the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata. The results showed that OA altered the abundance and secondary structure of byssal proteins and affected the contents of metal ions in distal threads, which together reduced the byssus diameter and amplified byssus nanocavity, causing reductions in mechanical properties (strength and extensibility). Expression analysis of key foot protein genes further confirmed changes in byssal protein abundance. Moreover, comparative transcriptome analysis revealed enrichment of ion transportation- and apoptosis-related categories, up-regulation of apoptosis-related pathways, and down-regulation of the "extracellular matrix-receptor interaction" pathway, which may influence foot locomotion physiology, leading to a decrease in byssus production. This study provides mechanistic insight into the effects of OA on pearl oyster byssus, which should broaden our overall understanding of the impacts of OA on marine ecosystem.

WHTXEiaA.title: Cloning, characterization and functional analysis of an Alveoline-like protein in the shell of Pinctada fucata.
WHTXEiaA.abstract: Shell matrix proteins (SMPs) have important functions in biomineralization. In the past decades, the roles of SMPs were gradually revealed. In 2015, our group identified 72 unique SMPs in Pinctada fucata, among which Alveoline-like (Alv) protein was reported to have homologous genes in Pinctada maxima and Pinctada margaritifera. In this study, the full-length cDNA sequence of Alv and the functional analysis of Alv protein during shell formation were explored. The deduced protein (Alv), which has a molecular mass of 24.9 kDa and an isoelectric point of 11.34, was characterized, and the functional analyses was explored in vivo and in vitro. The Alv gene has high expression in mantle and could response to notching damage. The functional inhibition of Alv protein in vivo by injecting recombinant Alv (rAlv) antibodies destroyed prism structure but accelerated nacre growth. Western blot and immunofluorescence staining showed that native Alv exists in the EDTA-insoluble matrix of both prismatic and nacreous layers and has different distribution patterns in the inner or outer prismatic layer. Taken together, the characterization and functional analyses of matrix protein Alv could expand our understanding of basic matrix proteins and their functions during shell formation.

BBYnWotq.title: The AP-1 transcription factor homolog Pf -AP-1 activates transcription of multiple biomineral proteins and potentially participates in Pinctada fucata biomineralization
BBYnWotq.abstract: Activator protein-1 (AP-1) is an important bZIP transcription factor that regulates a series of physiological processes by specifically activating transcription of several genes, and one of its well-chartered functions in mammals is participating in bone mineralization. We isolated and cloned the complete cDNA of a Jun/AP-1 homolog from Pinctada fucata and called it Pf-AP-1. Pf-AP-1 had a highly conserved bZIP region and phosphorylation sites compared with those from mammals. A tissue distribution analysis showed that Pf-AP-1 was ubiquitously expressed in P. fucata and the mRNA level of Pf-AP-1 is extremely high in mantle. Pf-AP-1 expression was positively associated with multiple biomineral proteins in the mantle. The luciferase reporter assay in a mammalian cell line showed that Pf-AP-1 significantly up-regulates the transcriptional activity of the promoters of KRMP, Pearlin, and Prisilkin39. Inhibiting the activity of Pf-AP-1 depressed the expression of multiple matrix proteins. Pf-AP-1 showed a unique expression pattern during shell regeneration and pearl sac development, which was similar to the pattern observed for biomineral proteins. These results suggest that the Pf-AP-1 AP-1 homolog is an important transcription factor that regulates transcription of several biomineral proteins simultaneously and plays a role in P. fucata biomineralization, particularly during pearl and shell formation.

rFgsB4lD.title: Identification and expression characterization of three Wnt signaling genes in pearl oyster (Pinctada fucata).
rFgsB4lD.abstract: The Wnt signaling pathway plays an important role in animal development and in the biomineralization process. At present, although the biomineralization mechanism in pearl oyster (Pinctada fucata) has been extensively studied, there is little research on the Wnt signaling pathway in pearl oyster. To understand the potential role of the Wnt signaling pathway in pearl oyster, we cloned and sequenced three genes from the Wnt signaling pathway in pearl oyster that encode the following proteins: β-catenin, Dishevelled (Dvl) and T-cell factor (TCF). Genomic structure analysis revealed that Pf-β-catenin genomic DNA contained 15 exons, Pf-Dvl genomic DNA contained 16 exons, and Pf-TCF genomic DNA contained 7 exons. Their deduced amino acid sequences all showed the highest identity with homologs in Crassostrea gigas. Yeast two-hybrid analysis verified that Pf-β-catenin interacted with Pf-TCF. These three genes were ubiquitously expressed in seven pearl oyster tissues analyzed with the highest expression in the gill and a certain amount of expression in the mantle, a tissue related to shell formation. After shell notching, the dynamic changes in expression of these three genes showed that they reached a maximum at 4days, indicating their response to shell regeneration. All three genes were constitutively expressed during five developmental stages of the pearl oyster, with high levels at the early embryonic development stage. Taken together, these results suggested that Pf-β-catenin, Pf-Dvl and Pf-TCF might participate in shell formation and early embryonic and larval development in the pearl oyster.

EoW4QrSy.title: The receptor genes PfBMPR1B and PfBAMBI are involved in regulating shell biomineralization in the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata.
EoW4QrSy.abstract: Mounting evidence suggests that TGFβ/BMP signaling pathway is most likely involved in shell biomineralization in molluscs, but the function of pathway receptors is poorly studied. Here, we cloned and identified two homologous BMP receptor genes, PfBMPR1B and PfBAMBI, from the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata. Real-time quantitative PCR and in situ hybridization revealed that these genes were expressed in mantle edge and pallial, specifically located at the outer epithelia. Knockdown of PfBMPR1B by RNA interference (RNAi) significantly decreased the expression levels of matrix protein (MP) genes and induced the abnormal ultrastructure of prismatic and nacreous layers. Conversely, knockdown of PfBAMBI significantly increased the expression levels of a portion of MP genes and induced the overgrowth of nacreous layer crystals. In the RNAi and shell notching experiments, MP gene expressions were competitively regulated by PfBMPR1B and PfBAMBI. In addition, the receptor inhibitor LDN193189 reduced the expression levels of MP genes in mantle primary cells and larvae, and induced abnormal D-shaped shell formation during larval development. Collectively, these results clearly show that PfBMPR1B and PfBAMBI are involved in regulating shell biomineralization in P. fucata. Our study therefore provides the direct evidence that BMP receptors participate in mollusc biomineralization.

Y8oYwppN.title: Extensible byssus of Pinctada fucata : Ca 2+ -stabilized nanocavities and a thrombospondin-1 protein
Y8oYwppN.abstract: The extensible byssus is produced by the foot of bivalve animals, including the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata, and enables them to attach to hard underwater surfaces. However, the mechanism of their extensibility is not well understood. To understand this mechanism, we analyzed the ultrastructure, composition and mechanical properties of the P. fucata byssus using electron microscopy, elemental analysis, proteomics and mechanical testing. In contrast to the microstructures of Mytilus sp. byssus, the P. fucata byssus has an exterior cuticle without granules and an inner core with nanocavities. The removal of Ca2+ by ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) treatment expands the nanocavities and reduces the extensibility of the byssus, which is accompanied by a decrease in the β-sheet conformation of byssal proteins. Through proteomic methods, several proteins with antioxidant and anti-corrosive properties were identified as the main components of the distal byssus regions. Specifically, a protein containing thrombospondin-1 (TSP-1), which is highly expressed in the foot, is hypothesized to be responsible for byssus extensibility. Together, our findings demonstrate the importance of inorganic ions and multiple proteins for bivalve byssus extension, which could guide the future design of biomaterials for use in seawater.

O333ZIVn.title: A Novel Matrix Protein, PfY2, Functions as a Crucial Macromolecule during Shell Formation.
O333ZIVn.abstract: Biomineralization, including shell formation, is dedicatedly regulated by matrix proteins. PfY2, a matrix protein detected in the ethylene diamine tetraacetic acid (EDTA)-soluble fraction from both prismatic layer and nacreous layer, was discovered by our group using microarray. It may play dual roles during biomineralization. However, the molecular mechanism is still unclear. In this research, we studied the function of PfY2 on crystallization in vivo and in vitro, revealing that it might be a negative regulator during shell formation. Notching experiment indicated that PfY2 was involved in shell repairing and regenerating process. Repression of PfY2 gene affected the structure of prismatic and nacreous layer simultaneously, confirming its dual roles in shell formation. Recombinant protein rPfY2 significantly suppressed CaCO precipitation rate, participated in the crystal nucleation process, changed the morphology of crystals and inhibited the transformation of amorphous calcium carbonate (ACC) to stable calcite or aragonite in vitro. Our results may provide new evidence on the biomineralization inhibition process.

M3bMM7gw.title: Mineralization of nacre-like structures mediated by extrapallial fluid on pearl nucleus
M3bMM7gw.abstract: Nacre is renowned for its fascinating iridescence and superior mechanical properties owing to their hierarchically ordered structures at multiscale levels. However, mechanisms for constructing these ordered structures and bottom-up strategies to synthesize nacre-like materials are still lacking. Here, we developed a CaCO3 deposition system in vitro to mimic biomineralization process in vivo. Strikingly, in the presence of extrapallial fluid (EPF) from the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata, a multilevel layered nacre-like structure was formed on pearl nucleus. Particularly, aragonite nanocolumns with diameters of 30–60 nm aggregated by a parallel pattern and assembled into polygonal tablets in each layer. Moreover, linkers between adjacent laminated layers were observed, resembling mineral bridges in natural nacre. Thus, we found that EPF could induce the mineralization of nacre-like structures on pearl nucleus in vitro, which would be helpful for better understanding the mechanism for assembling layered struct...

GLffLKnB.title: Cloning and mineralization-related functions of the calponin gene in Chlamys farreri.
GLffLKnB.abstract: Calponin is a widely distributed protein which is associated with the bio-mineralization process in vertebrates. Recently, a new type of calponin has been found in shellfish; the present study aimed to determine if this gene in shellfish functions in bio-mineralization, one of the most important processes in a mollusk's growth. We chose Chlamys farreri, a seashell species with great economic value, as the object of the study and obtained its full-length cDNA to study the function of calponin by gene expression analysis, shell notching experiment and RNA interference assays. Calponin in C. farreri is a basic protein that is highly conserved among mollusk species. Except for high expression in the adductor muscle and foot, which correlated with its function of regulating muscle contraction, the calponin gene was expressed more in the mantle than in other tissues. The expression of the gene was induced by shell notching and an RNA interference assay showed that inhibition of calponin expression caused the growth of irregular mineral crystals on the shell. Further analysis indicated that calponin might function by regulating the expression of other mineralization-related genes. Calponin is a mineralization-related protein in C. farreri that might influence mineral crystal growth by affecting the expressions of other proteins, such as matrix proteins and mineralization-regulating proteins.

CBTPiak2.title: Hemocytes participate in calcium carbonate crystal formation, transportation and shell regeneration in the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata.
CBTPiak2.abstract: In this study, light microscope, scanning and transmission electron microscope, hematoxylin-eosin and fluorescent staining, and mass spectrometry methods were employed to observe the calcium carbonate (CaCO3) crystal formation, hemocyte release and transportation, and hemocyte distribution at the shell regeneration area and to analyse the proteome of hemocytes in the pearl oyster, Pinctada fucata. The results indicated that intracellular CaCO3 crystals were observed in circulating hemocytes in P. fucata, implying that there was a suitable microenvironment for crystal formation in the hemocytes. This conclusion was further supported by the proteome analysis, in which various biomineralization-related proteins were detected. The crystal-bearing hemocytes, mainly granulocytes, may be released to extrapallial fluid (EPF) by the secretory cavities distributed on the outer surface of the mantle centre. These granulocytes in the EPF and between the regenerated shells were abundant and free. In the regenerated prismatic layer, the granulocytes were fused into each column and fragmented with the duration of shell maturation, suggesting the direct involvement of hemocytes in shell regeneration. Overall, this study provided evidence that hemocytes participated in CaCO3 crystal formation, transportation and shell regeneration in the pearl oyster. These results are helpful to further understand the exact mechanism of hemocyte-mediated biomineralization in shelled molluscs.

XohsqVsR.title: Transformation of amorphous calcium carbonate nanoparticles into aragonite controlled by ACCBP
XohsqVsR.abstract: Polymorph selection during shell or pearl formation has been an intriguing issue, especially for those species of interest for human consumption. The polymorph switching of calcium carbonate controlled by amorphous calcium carbonate-binding protein (ACCBP), an extrapallial fluid (EPF) protein from the pearl oyster identified by our group in 2007, is investigated in this research. FTIR and TGA analysis suggest that ACCBP decreases the bound water content of amorphous calcium carbonate (ACC), suggesting that ACCBP may be involved in biogenic anhydrous ACC formation. In vitro crystallization and ACC transformation experiments show that ACCBP induces aragonite formation via an ACC precursor in Mg/Ca = 1 and Mg/Ca = 2 solutions at low temperature. Raman, FTIR, ICP and XPS analyses of the initial-stage ACC nanoparticles in the ACC transformation experiment suggest that this polymorph switching may be controlled by increasing the surface Mg/Ca ratio of the ACC, rather than by regulating the bulk Mg/Ca ratio or the short-range ordered structure. These results suggest that the polymorph selection in nacre or pearl growth may be controlled not only by the nucleating template on the matrix but also by the physicochemical effects of EPF proteins.

gFyzc9sR.title: Shell repair and the potential microbial causal in a shell disease of the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata.
gFyzc9sR.abstract: The pearl oyster Pinctada fucata is famous for producing luxurious pearls. As filter feeders, they are confronted with various infectious microorganisms. Despite a long history of aquaculture, diseases in P. fucata are not well studied, which limits the development of the pearl industry. We report here a shell disease in P. fucata and a study of the shell repair processes. Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) revealed that the nacreous layer gradually recovered from disordered CaCO deposition, accompanied by a polymorphic transition from a calcite-aragonite mixture to an aragonite-dominant composition, as revealed by X-ray diffraction analysis. SEM also showed that numerous microbes were embedded in the abnormal shell layers. Similar indications were induced by a high concentration of microbes injected into the extrapallial space, suggesting the potential pathogenic effect of uncontrolled microbes. Furthermore, hemocytes were found to participate in pathogens resistance and might promote shell repair. These results further our understanding of pathogen-host interactions in pearl oysters and have implications for biotic control in pearl aquaculture.

IX7kiL58.title: Alv protein plays opposite roles in the transition of amorphous calcium carbonate to calcite and aragonite during shell formation
IX7kiL58.abstract: Amorphous calcium carbonate (ACC) is an important precursor in biominerals such as shells, coral, foraminiferans, and urchin spine. However, the mechanism underlying the transition from ACC to stable biosynthetic crystals is still poorly understood. Herein, we identified a matrix protein referred to as Alv in Pinctada fucata, which has dramatically opposite functions during the different transition processes from ACC to stable crystals—calcite and aragonite in shell formation. The functions of Alv were studied by RNA interference, binding of recombinant Alv (rAlv) to chitin, calcite and aragonite assay, ACC transition, in vitro crystallization, calcium carbonate precipitation, and near-UV CD spectra. We found that rAlv could promote nucleation during ACC crystallization, stimulate the transition from ACC to calcite, but suppress transition from ACC to aragonite. It is concluded that Alv is involved in the transition of ACC, and plays a crucial role in the formation of shells. As far as we know, Alv is one...

g2fC5mhs.title: A novel basic matrix protein of Pinctada fucata, PNU9, functions as inhibitor during crystallization of aragonite
g2fC5mhs.abstract: Shell matrix proteins (SMPs) which participate in shell formation are important components in shells of Pinctada fucata. The 72 unique SMPs of P. fucata were identified before, among which, PNU9, which is a part of an EDTA-insoluble matrix (EISM) of prism and nacre, got our attention. The expression of PNU9 mRNA concentrated on the outer fold (OF) and mantle pallial (MP) of the mantle, which is an important tissue for biomineralization. The result of a shell notching assay suggested that PNU9 participated in shell damage repairing processes. The injection of dsRNA of PNU9 could lead to the overgrowth of nacreous lamellas but had no significant influence on the prismatic layer. According to the results of the crystallization experiment in vitro, rPNU9 (mbp-PNU9) was able to inhibit crystal growth during aragonite crystallization and influence the morphology of calcite. Whatu0027s more, rPNU9 could inhibit precipitation of calcium carbonate and the amorphous calcium carbonate (ACC) transition in the aragonite system. The above results may offer new thoughts on the role of shell matrix proteins in the biomineralization process of the nacreous layer.

LYWe1Niu.title: Ca2+ Mediates the Self-Assembly of the Foot Proteins of Pinctada fucata from the Nanoscale to the Microscale
LYWe1Niu.abstract: Bivalve animals such as mussels and pearl oysters secrete proteinaceous byssus from the foot to attach themselves to solid surfaces under seawater. Although the biomolecules of mussel byssus have been extensively studied, how they form insoluble threads underwater from soluble protein precursors and how they produce hierarchical microscale threads from biomolecules remains unclear. Here, using the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata as a model, metal ions rather than pH are found to play critical roles in the solidification process of the byssus. Particularly, Ca2+ can induce self-assembly of the foot proteins and the byssal proteins, resulting in aggregate formation. At a concentration of 10 mM, protein fibers with a diameter of approximately 26 μm and a length ranging from 50 to 400 μm were formed. Moreover, the fibers are composed of 60–90 nm nanospheres, reminiscent of the ultrastructure sizes of threads. It is proposed that Ca2+ can interact with byssal proteins such as thrombospondin-1 containing protein through phosphorylated serine and/or von Willebrand factor type A domains. This study provides insight into how the byssus forms from the soluble protein molecules into insoluble threads underwater and may inspire further biomaterial design for underwater use.

DYZ6wy2S.title: fam20C participates in the shell formation in the pearl oyster, Pinctada fucata.
DYZ6wy2S.abstract: Kinase-family with sequence similarity 20, member C (Fam20C) is a protein kinase, which can phosphorylate biomineralization related proteins in vertebrate animals. However, the function of Fam20C in invertebrate animals especially the role in biomineralization is still unknown. Herein, we cloned the cDNA of fam20C from the pearl oyster, Pinctada fucata. It is showed that the expression of fam20C in the mantle edge was much higher than other tissues. In situ hybridization showed that fam20C was expressed mostly in the outer epithelial cells of the middle fold, indicating it may play important roles in the shell formation. Besides, fam20C expression increased greatly in the D-shape stage of pearl oyster development, when the shell was first formed. During the shell repair process, the expression level of fam20C increased 1.5 times at 6 h after shell notching. Knockdown of fam20C in vivo by RNA interference resulted in abnormally stacking of calcium carbonate crystals at the edges of nacre tablets, showing direct evidence that fam20C participates in the shell formation. This study provides an insight into the role of kinase protein in the shell formation in mollusk and broaden our understanding of biomineralization mechanism.

ClZCO69o.title: Transcriptional regulation of the matrix protein Shematrin-2 during shell formation in pearl oyster.
ClZCO69o.abstract: The molluscan shell is a fascinating biomineral consisting of a highly organized calcium carbonate composite. Biomineralization is elaborately controlled and involves several macromolecules, especially matrix proteins, but little is known about the regulatory mechanisms. The matrix protein Shematrin-2, expression of which peaks in the mantle tissues and in the shell components of the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata, has been suggested to be a key participant in biomineralization. Here, we expressed and purified Shematrin-2 from P. fucata and explored its function and transcriptional regulation. An in vitro functional assay revealed that Shematrin-2 binds the calcite, aragonite, and chitin components of the shell, decreases the rate of calcium carbonate deposition, and changes the morphology of the deposited crystal in the calcite crystallization system. Furthermore, we cloned the Shematrin-2 gene promoter, and analysis of its sequence revealed putative binding sites for the transcription factors CCAAT enhancer-binding proteins (Pf-C/EBPs) and nuclear factor-Y (NF-Y). Using transient co-transfection and reporter gene assays, we found that cloned and recombinantly expressed Pf-C/EBP-A and Pf-C/EBP-B greatly and dose-dependently up-regulate the promoter activity of the Shematrin-2 gene. Importantly, Pf-C/EBP-A and Pf-C/EBP-B knockdowns decreased Shematrin-2 gene expression and induced changes in the inner-surface structures in prismatic layers that were similar to those of antibody-based Shematrin-2 inhibition.  Altogether, our data reveal that the transcription factors Pf-C/EBP-A and Pf-C/EBP-B up-regulate the expression of the matrix protein Shematrin-2 during shell formation in P. fucata, improving our understanding of the transcriptional regulation of molluscan shell development at the molecular level.

jGRZHztD.title: Amorphous calcium carbonate: A precursor phase for aragonite in shell disease of the pearl oyster.
jGRZHztD.abstract: Amorphous calcium carbonate (ACC) has long been shown to act as an important constituent or precursor phase for crystalline material in mollusks. However, the presence and the role of ACC in bivalve shell formation are not fully studied. In this study, we found that brown deposits containing heterogeneous calcium carbonates were precipitated when a shell disease occurred in the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata. Calcein-staining of the brown deposits indicated that numerous amorphous calcium deposits were present, which was further confirmed by FTIR, Raman spectrum and XRD analysis. So we speculate that ACC plays an important role in rapid calcium carbonate precipitation during shell repair process in diseased oysters.

RoeOd8Ub.title: Direct control of shell regeneration by the mantle tissue in the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata via accelerating CaCO3 nucleation
RoeOd8Ub.abstract: Molluscan bivalves rapidly repair the damaged shells to prevent further injury. However, it remains unclear how this process is precisely controlled. In this study, we applied scanning electronic microscopy, transmission electronic microscopy and histochemical analysis to examine the detailed shell regeneration process of the pearl oyster Pinctada fucata. It was found that the shell damage caused the mantle tissue to retract, which resulted in dislocation of the mantle zones to their correspondingly secreted shell layers. However, the secretory repertoires of the different mantle zones remained unchanged. As a result, the dislocation of the mantle tissue dramatically affected the shell morphology, and the unusual presence of the submarginal zone on the nacreous layers caused de novo precipitation of prismatic layers on the nacreous layers. Real-time PCR revealed that the expression of the shell matrix proteins (SMPs) were significantly upregulated, which was confirmed by the thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) of the newly formed shell. The increased matrix secretion accelerated CaCO3 nucleation thus promoting shell deposition. Taken together, our study revealed the close relationship between the physiological activities of the mantle tissue and the morphological change of the regenerated shells.
